author: /cronologia/-/meta/redaccion-web
title: Capturan a guardia acusado de abusar de menor de siete aÃ±os
text: [Guardia](/cronologia/-/meta/guardia) Un guardia de seguridad identificado como JerÃ³nimo Torres HernÃ¡ndez (53) fue capturado en la colonia Las AmÃ©rica de Tegucigalpa para reponder por una orden de captura que fue emitida desde el 2016 en la que se le acusa de abusar de una menor de siete aÃ±os. A Torres HernÃ¡ndez lo capturÃ³ la Unidad Nacional Antisecuestros (Unas) de la DPI mediante labores de Vigilancia en la Colonia Las Americas. JerÃ³nimo tenÃ­a una orden de captura pendiente por el delito de Actos de lujuria agravados, en perjuicio de una menor de siete aÃ±os, a quien el ahora imputado supuestamente acosaba sexual y psicologicamente. Actos de lujuria de guardia de seguridad SegÃºn la orden de arresto, Torres tocaba las partes Ã­ntimas de la niÃ±a aprovechÃ¡ndo el momento que la menor se encontraba sola en su casa de habitaciÃ³n. La orden arresto fue emitida por el Juzgado de Letras de la Seccion Judicial de Tegucigalpa, Departamento de Francisco Morazan, en fecha 16 de agosto del aÃ±o 2016, Exp. No: 214-2013-Juez #14 Torres fue trasladado al juzgado, para que se le siga el procedimiento legal correspondiente.

author: Elisabeth McGowan
title: Kim Kardashian Admits She Struggles to Discipline Her Kids â€“ Hollywood Life
text: Kim Kardashian canâ€™t keep up with her kids sometimes, she admitted in a new episode of The Kardashians. During one scene from the Thursday, June 6, episode, the 43-year-old mom of four vented about how â€œchaoticâ€ the kiddos â€” North, Saint, Chicago and Psalm West â€” are. She shares her children with ex-husband Kanye â€œYeâ€ West . â€œLike, Iâ€™ve [run] out of my patience, and that what my like superpower was, calm and patience,â€ the SKIMS boss said. â€œThey know when to con me and when to throw the little, you know, start with the tears, so Iâ€™m like, â€˜Stop, stop, sure, take an iPad,â€™ you know, â€˜just stop.'â€ Kim also admitted that she wished could be more â€œstrictâ€ with her children like her sister KhloÃ© Kardashian , who shares her two kids, True and Tatum, with ex Tristan Thompson. â€œSometimes, it gets just like a little intense,â€ she noted. â€œI want to be more strict like Khloe, but I donâ€™t know why I have a hard time just saying â€˜no is no.â€™ I think I also just donâ€™t want to deal with the whining and the tears of not getting their way.â€ The Hulu personality then described the moment she took a Zoom call while â€œliterally hiding in a bathroomâ€ away from her kids. â€œI had a Zoom at the house with all my kids there, banging on the door, just screaming, and I was literally hiding in a bathroom with the door locked as I was just like, â€˜I canâ€™t believe this,'â€ Kim said. â€œI mean I can believe it, but thatâ€™s like my biggest nightmare.â€ As a â€œa single mom of four,â€ the Keeping Up with the Kardashians alum noted that life gets â€œwildâ€ sometimes. However, Kim knows she has to stand her ground when it comes to disciplining her children. She added, â€œI just have to be like, â€˜I donâ€™t care if youâ€™re gonna throw a tantrum in front of everyone right now. The answer is no.'â€ â€œI almost feel like my kids have this radar where they know that Iâ€™m doing something really important,â€ she joked. â€œI thought I was going to end up on an episode of Snapped yesterday.â€ Although the going gets tough, Kim insisted that she will â€œalways be there for [her] kids, and [sheâ€™ll] ride out anything with them.â€ Nevertheless, â€œto say that it doesnâ€™t take an emotional toll sometimes, would be lying,â€ Kim concluded.

author: iheart.com
title: Unknown Chemical Detected in US Drinking Water | BOB 94.9 | WHP580 Newsroom
text:
Photo: Getty Images
An international team of scientists has identified a previously unknown compound in the drinking water of approximately one-third of Americans. The compound, named chloronitramide anion, is a byproduct of chloramine, a chemical used by many water treatment plants to make water safe to drink. The study, published in the journal Science, has raised concerns about potential health risks associated with the compound.
The researchers, led by Julian Fairey of the University of Arkansas, used advanced techniques to isolate and identify the compound. They found that about 113 million people are exposed to chloronitramide anion through their tap water. However, the toxicity of the compound is currently unknown. The study authors noted that the properties of chloronitramide anion are similar to those of other molecules that are toxic enough for the government to regulate them. According to CNN , the researchers are calling for further research to understand the potential implications of chloronitramide anion in drinking water.
Chloramines have been widely used as an alternative to chlorine for disinfecting drinking water since the 1970s. While they don't seem to have the same potentially dangerous byproducts as chlorine, scientists have noticed that chloramines also create byproducts, one of which remained a mystery until now. Newsweek reports that the discovery of chloronitramide anion could reignite debate over the widespread use of chloramines in water treatment.

author: Sean Wolfe
title: Hawaiian Electric aims to streamline rooftop solar program
text: Rooftop Sean Wolfe 4.11.2024 Share (Courtesy: Ricardo Gomez Angel/Unsplash) Hawaiian Electric has launched a new framework that streamlines and consolidates choices for customers participating in the companyâ€™s rooftop solar energy programs, replacing several existing rooftop solar and energy storage programs. â€œSmart Renewable Energy,â€ also known as Smart DER, was developed under the oversight of the Public Utilities Commission. It consolidates and replaces all of Hawaiian Electricâ€™s previous rooftop solar programs except for Net Energy Metering (NEM). For solar customers who want to pair their rooftop systems with energy storage, Hawaiian Electric is also offering a new incentive program called â€œBring Your Own Deviceâ€ (BYOD), which is replacing Battery Bonus. (On Maui, Battery Bonus will remain open to new applicants until enrolled capacity reaches 15 MW or until June 30, whichever comes first.) Going forward, customers who apply to install a grid-connected solar system must do so through Smart Renewable Energy, which offers an export and a non-export track. Customers enrolled in one of Hawaiian Electricâ€™s rooftop solar or energy storage programs prior to the change have several options to choose from as the company transitions to Smart Renewable Energy and BYOD: NEM and NEM Plus: No changes will be required for customers in these programs. Customer Grid Supply (CGS), CGS Plus, and Smart Export: Customers enrolled in these programs must transition to the Smart DER export track no later than seven years after their initial agreement date, starting Oct. 1, 2024. The transition will be done automatically by Hawaiian Electric. Customer Self Supply or Standard Interconnection Agreement: Customers enrolled in these programs are not required to switch to Smart Renewable Energy, but if they choose to do so they will transition to the programâ€™s non-export track. Customers in any of the above programs have the option of transitioning to Smart Renewable Energy before their agreement end date by filling out a form on Hawaiian Electricâ€™s website. Battery Bonus: Customers are not required to transition to the new BYOD program but have the option to do so prior to their Battery Bonus agreement ending. Join us at GridTECH Connect California, June 24-26, 2024, in Newport Beach, CA! With some of the most ambitious sustainability and clean energy goals in the country, California is at the cutting edge of the energy transition while confronting its most cumbersome roadblocks. From electric vehicles to battery storage, microgrids, community solar, and everything in between, attendees will collaborate to advance interconnection procedures and policies in California. â€œWe are excited to offer our customers Smart Renewable Energy and BYOD, which give them an opportunity to offset their energy bills while helping make the grid more resilient,â€ said Kaiulani Shinsato, Hawaiian Electric Customer Energy Resources co-director. â€œHawaiian Electric is thankful to all the stakeholders who worked so hard to bring this to fruition.â€ Smart Renewable Energy and BYOD are the culmination of a multi-year regulatory effort that included input from the PUC, Hawaiian Electric, solar industry representatives, and the Consumer Advocate. The Smart Renewable Energy export rates and other information about the new programs are available at hawaiianelectric.com/smartprograms. Share Tags battery BESS Hawaii NEM rooftop solar solar Related Posts Puerto Rico can hit 100% renewables by 2050 with â€˜significantâ€™ investments, report finds EIA: April 8 Eclipse will â€˜brieflyâ€™ limit solar generation across the U.S. The interconnection event: GridTECH Connect Forum â€“ California agenda is live! DOE increases funding and support for community clean energy program

author: Dan Fappiano
title: Phillies call up key trade deadline acquisition ahead of playoffs
text:
With their NL East leading 83-56 record, the
[Philadelphia Phillies](/mlb/philadelphia-phillies) are well on their way to clinching a playoff spot. Before they embark on their postseason run, the Phillies wanted to get a closer look at one of their more intriguing prospects.
Philadelphia is
calling up right-handed pitcher Seth Johnson to start against the Marlins on Sunday, via Kiley McDaniel of ESPN. Johnson was acquired in the trade that sent Gregory Soto to the Baltimore Orioles.
Johnson was selected as the 40th overall pick in 2019. However, he played shortstop a year prior. But since making the switch to full-time pitcher, the righty has shown he has true major league potential.
Over his 67 games at the minor league level, Johnson pitched to a 2.70 ERA and a 269/94 K/BB ratio. During the 2024 campaign â€“ which Johnson has split between the Double and Triple-A levels â€“ he has thrown to a 2.33 ERA and a 83/42 K/BB ratio. In his most recent outing, Johnson pitched six innings of scoreless baseball, allowing one hit and walk while striking out five.
Now, Johnson will have an opportunity to prove himself at the major league level. He'll be joining one of the best pitching rotations in the league. Led
by players such as Zach Wheeler, Philadelphia ranks fourth in the league with their 3.70 ERA. They've struck out the eighth-most batters (1,232) while walking the third-fewest (369).
Ranked as the
15th-best prospect in the Phillies' organization, via MLB Pipeline, Johnson will have an opportunity to prove himself against the Marlins. However, a strong performance could keep Johnson in the rotation on a much more long-term basis.
Philadelphia recently
demoted Taijuan Walker to the bullpen. His last outing saw him allow four hits two earned runs in three innings. In his two starts previously, Walker allowed 21 hits and 12 earned runs in nine innings. He had a 2/2 K/BB ratio.
If Johnson impresses against the Marlins, Walker's demotion could become more permanent. The Phillies are serious in their World Series intentions and want to put their best roster forward. Despite his winding path to the majors, Johnson can prove he should be a part of it on Sunday.

author: @ValleyNewsLive
title: Fargo man charged with terrorizing, accused of holding woman and two-year-old in feces-covered trailer
text: Fargo man charged with terrorizing, accused of holding woman and two-year-old in feces-covered trailer FARGO, N.D. (Valley News Live) - A Fargo man, James Robert Ludwikowski, is facing 6 charges after a reported terrorizing incident on April 20th. It happened at Rivera Heights Mobile Home Community, which is near the airport. Police responded to a call there just after midnight on 4/21, according to court documents, where a woman told officers she had been locked inside the trailer with a padlock and no way out. She reportedly showed officers a voicemail from Ludwikowski, threatening to kill her if she wasnâ€™t there. Officer state the trailer was covered in dirt and holes. The documents state the victim told police she was only allowed to use the bathroom connected to their room, which did not have a working toilet, so she had to use a cup and box to go to the bathroom. The court documents state Jamesâ€™s son from a previous marriage was in the back room. Officers reportedly found him rolling around in his own feces, playing on tablets covered in feces. The child was taken into protective custody. Ludwikowski was detailed just after 1 AM, reportedly smelling of alcohol and admitting to drinking. According to the court documents, he blamed the state of the house on the victim. Ludwikowski is charged with terrorizing, 2 counts of child neglect, DUI, possession of marijuana and possession of drug paraphernalia. Heâ€™s pleaded not guilty to the DUI, possession of marijuana and possession of drug paraphernalia charges. His preliminary heading has been scheduled for June 5th. Copyright 2024 KVLY. All rights reserved.

author: Agencias
title: El Papa Francisco necesita
text:
El Vaticano
El Papa Francisco necesita "reposo absoluto" y no pronunciarÃ¡ el Ãngelus maÃ±ana domingo
Francisco ingresÃ³ el lunes por una bronquitis y ha suspendido su agenda hasta el lunes
El Papa Francisco necesita "reposo absoluto" y no pronunciarÃ¡ el Ãngelus maÃ±ana domingo / El Vaticano
El Papa Francisco necesita "reposo absoluto" para facilitar su recuperaciÃ³n, por lo que no dirigirÃ¡ la oraciÃ³n del Ãngelus maÃ±ana domingo, tras ser ingresado este viernes en el hospital Gemelli de Roma por una infecciÃ³n en las vÃ­as respiratorias, informÃ³ el Vaticano.
La Conferencia Episcopal EspaÃ±ola ha animado a los fieles catÃ³licos "a permanecer unidos en la oraciÃ³n por el pronto restablecimiento del Papa Francisco" y ha propuesto que, en las eucaristÃ­as que se celebren en los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as, se haga una peticiÃ³n expresa por la salud del Santo Padre.
El Papa Francisco ha pasado "tranquilo" su primera noche de ingreso en el hospital Gemelli de Roma, en el que ingresÃ³ ayer por una bronquitis que le estÃ¡ afectando las vÃ­as respiratorias. El sumo pontÃ­fice ha conseguido que bajara la leve fiebre que le aquejaba, segÃºn fuentes vaticanas citadas por la televisiÃ³n pÃºblica RAI y la agencia Ansa.
El Papa, de 88 aÃ±os, no ha impedido desarrollar con normalidad su agenda en los Ãºltimos dÃ­as, en tanto que le dificultaba la lectura de sus discursos y finalmente le ha obligado a hospitalizarse para recibir diagnÃ³sticos y los subsiguientes tratamientos mÃ©dicos.

author: @indianexpress
title: After abrupt rise in mercury levels, Mumbai sees seasonâ€™s coldest day at 16.2 degrees Celsius | Mumbai News - The Indian Express
text: After days of summer-like hot and humid conditions, Mumbai residents were in for a delight on Tuesday morning as the city recorded the lowest temperature of the season so far with the Santacruz observatory recording a minimum temperature of 16.2 degrees Celsius. According to scientists and weather experts, the coastal city is experiencing a drop in temperature owing to the northerly winds that arrived on Sunday. The Regional Meteorological Centre in Colaba, meanwhile, recorded a minimum temperature of 18.8 degrees Celsius, indicating a sharp drop from Monday when it was 22 degrees Celsius. Before this, the coldest day of the season was January 6 when the temperature dropped to 17.5 degrees Celsius. Following this drop, however, the city started experiencing a sudden temperature rise. Amid the soaring heat, [Mumbai](https://indianexpress.com/section/cities/mumbai/) also recorded the warmest day in January in the past seven years at 35.7 degrees Celsius on January 12. Speaking to [The Indian Express](https://indianexpress.com), Sushma Nair, Scientist at IMD Mumbai, said, â€œLast week, the city was reeling under high temperatures owing to the prominent southeasterly winds, which are moist in nature. However, since Sunday, we have had the northerly wind component, which is dry and cold, which has resulted in a drop in temperature.â€ The maximum temperature in the city has also dropped from Mondayâ€™s nearly 34 degrees Celsius to around 31 degrees in the suburbs as well as in the island city division. The maximum temperature is expected to remain between 30 â€“ 31 degrees Celsius for a day or two, before dropping below 30 degrees, IMD scientists said. Mumbai also breathed easy with the overall AQI touching 69, which is categorised as â€˜satisfactoryâ€™. Barring two, the cityâ€™s 24 stations recorded an AQI in double digits. The best air quality was observed in Vile Parle West (45) and Borivali East (38) where the AQI dropped below 50, which falls in the â€˜goodâ€™ category. â€œThe change in wind direction is largely responsible for the good AQI,â€ Nair said.
